name: altopex

stmt.origin: eqeltri(caltop(c0, c1), universe, cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, csn(c1))))
stmt.pretty: eqeltri(<< c0, c1 >>, universe, { { c0 }, { c0, { c1 } } })

body.origin:
|- wcel(caltop(c0, c1), universe)
-| wceq(caltop(c0, c1), cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, csn(c1))))
-| wcel(cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, csn(c1))), universe)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(caltop(c0, c1), universe)
-| wceq(caltop(c0, c1), cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, csn(c1))))
-| wcel(cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, csn(c1))), universe)

|- wcel(caltop(c0, c1), universe)
-| wcel(cpr(csn(c0), cpr(c0, csn(c1))), universe)

comment: Alternative ordered pairs always exist. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 22-Mar-2012.)
